org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.report

Class Report

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bicycleGeometryWorkshop.report.Report

  • public class Report
extends java.lang.Object
    The report class manages all the data to display in the UI JTable. The report is packed from the components (bicycles) and presented when called by the UI.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Report()
      Class constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the name of the report - this is the Bicycle Name.
        Parameters:
        name - The Name of the Bicycle

      • getDataRow

        public ReportValue[] getDataRow(ReportValue[] colHeads)
        Get a data row from the report. Use the column heads as a guide to ensure the order of elements in the array.
        Parameters:
        colHeads - The Column heads - used for ordering the data.
        Returns:
        An array of ReportValues.

      • reportAngle

        public void reportAngle(ReportField field,
                        double theta)
        Add an angle to the report.
        Parameters:
        field - The field this angle belongs to.
        theta - The angle as raw radians (converted and formatted to degrees internally).

      • reportDistance

        public void reportDistance(ReportField field,
                           double dist)
        Add a distance to the report
        Parameters:
        field - The field this distance belongs to.
        dist - The distance (formated for distance internally).

      • getColumnHeads

        public static ReportValue[] getColumnHeads()
        Get an array of all the fields to be used as column heads for a JTable.
        Returns:
        String array of all the column heads.

      • getEmtpyDataRow

        public static ReportValue[] getEmtpyDataRow()
        Get an empty data row to be used when constructing a JTable.
        Returns:
        String array of empty data.
